ranked_diseases.explanation: Plexiform neurofibromas are pathognomonic for NF1, occurring in 25-30% of patients. This is the most common cause of plexiform neurofibromas.
A rare variant of neurofibromatosis that can present with plexiform neurofibromas, though less common than NF1.
A localized form of NF1 that can present with plexiform neurofibromas in a segmental distribution.
Can rarely present with café-au-lait spots and neurofibromas, though plexiform neurofibromas are uncommon.
An allelic variant of NF1 that can present with neurofibromas, though typically with additional features like pulmonary stenosis.
